title: Haverhill police chief put on leave amid multiple tragedies and outrage from families of officers
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Local News Chief Robert Pistone's department faced scrutiny after a man died in an interaction with officers in July.
The recent death of a Haverhill officer supercharged tensions.
Haverhill Police Chief Robert Pistone has been placed on leave, according to multiple reports.

title: Patriots’ Drake Maye, Will Campbell dine out together in Boston’s North End
author: John Waller
bullets: New England Patriots Perhaps a celebratory meal after New England's big win in Buffalo.

By John Waller October 9, 2025 | 11:33 AM 1 minute to read After their primetime upset win in Buffalo, young Patriots stars Drake Maye and Will Campbell took to Boston’s North End on Monday night, where they had dinner together at the Italian restaurant Tony & Elaine’s.
Patriots quarterback Drake Maye; Tony Frattaroli, one of the namesakes of Tony & Elaine’s; and Patriots rookie left tackle Will Campbell.

title: Skydiver dies three days after accident in Mass.
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Local News The cause of Robert Szabo’s fatal accident remains under investigation.
Skydivers at Jumptown Skydiving in Orange, Massachusetts, in 2014.
Jumptown allegedly operated the plane involved in the incident that fatally injured Robert Szabo Saturday.

title: ‘Yankees lose!’: Blue Jays share throwback photo of David Ortiz and Vladimir Guerrero Jr.
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Morning Sports Update Ortiz and Guerrero Jr.
celebrated the Yankees being eliminated from the playoffs.
David Ortiz at Fenway Park in Sept.

title: Woman rescued from 4 feet of water in the swamps of Walpole
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Local News The woman sustained non-life-threatening injuries.
ShareSend this article to your social connections.
A woman was rescued from a swamp in Walpole on Wednesday.

title: 3 teens killed in New Hampshire crash
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Local News Police are continuing to investigate the cause of the crash.
The scene of the crash.
New Hampshire State Police A car crashed into a telephone pole on Tuesday night, killing three teenagers in New Hampshire, according to police.

title: Blown off course, puffin found in Wrentham backyard recovering in R.I.
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Local News The rehabilitation center hopes the juvenile puffin will survive.
A puffin found in Wrentham is recovering in a Rhode Island rehabilitation facility.
Wrentham and Plainville Animal Control received a report of an injured bird in a residential area on Sunday afternoon.

title: If 2025-26 Bruins are competitive, a season-opening win mapped out winning formula
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins "They played exactly how I wanted them to play.
And that makes me happy.
” David Pastrnak posted three points in Wednesday's win.

title: Best coffee shops in Greater Boston, according to readers
author: Kristina DaPonte
bullets: Whether it’s your morning ritual or afternoon boost, coffee shops are what makes Boston go round.
From cozy neighborhood cafes to classic chains, readers shared their favorite spots to grab a cup across the state.
We’ve updated our guide to the best coffee shops and cafes, and reader favorites remain prominent on our list.

title: Massachusetts Senate backs data privacy bill giving consumers more control of their data
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Local News Lawmakers said the legislation would make Massachusetts one of the states with the strongest data privacy laws in the U.
S.
The Massachusetts State House.
